The rainforest and coastal forest are as important to the traditions of the islands as the traditions themselves. The landscape is pristine, covered with lush trees and fertile soil. The aroma of blossoming flowers blends with the shimmering moss around fresh water pools. Silktails flutter and chirp in the canopy. They can grow to almost five inches long with velvety black plumage and iridescent blue around their head and breast. Three waterfalls cascade around the landscape, the first tumbling from 78 feet in the air and an easy stroll from the entrance. The other waterfalls are a bit smaller but have tremendous swimming pools where the family can lounge in the untouched majesty of the rainforest.

dayInfo.title: Maravu Plantation – Beachside Charm
dayInfo.description: The turquoise water shines like a jewel beneath the morning sky. The wake laps at the shore and the clear coloration of the water’s edge shuffles back and forth, sifting through the sand. After breakfast, you can make your way to the beachside comforts of the Maravu Plantation Beach Resort to explore the length of the coastline on horseback. Palms stretch out of the forest and push against the water. The thatched huts offer shade on the powdery sand beaches. You and the kids saddle up and climb atop your noble steeds. Your guide leads you outwards where the water meets the land. The horses begin to trot, kicking up sand and splashing in the water. The spritz is cool and comfortable against the warm afternoon sun. You venture off the beach and into the rainforest following the cautious sounds of the birds in the trees. Your guide points along the branches and you see tagimoucia, an elegant flower of rich red outer petals and with a pure white center. The flower is only found near Lake Tagimoucia in a hill above the water. The kids delight at the rarity of the flora but also the incredible story that comes along with it.

dayInfo.title: Vanua Levu – Finding the Secret
dayInfo.description: The island of Savusavu is often referred to as Fiji’s best-kept secret. The town is located on the island of Vanua Levu and has a picturesque port nestled against a sweeping bay with sloping green hills in the background. The scent of hibiscus flowers roams through the air. The locals are friendly, always smiling and welcoming in every way. The island boasts lazy blue bays and towering palm trees, filled with remnants of old plantations marking the countryside. Your private transfer escorts you from the airport to your spectacular accommodation with a celebrated children’s program, which allows the kids to spend all day actively enjoying the their surroundings at the resort while you leisure your days away as you please. Near the water’s edge, you see steam rising, evidence of the volcanic activity beneath the town. Near the wharf, you can find shallow streams where locals come to cook and boil freshly caught seafood. Watching the unique natural hot springs and how the locals utilize the heat is captivating.

dayInfo.title: Vanua Levu – A Stroll in the Rain(forest)
dayInfo.description: A jetty ventures out into the calm waters adding an extra touch of seclusion to your resort. The tranquil landscape encircles your room, from rising palm trees to the stoic waters. After breakfast, you venture out of the resort and into the Waisali Rainforest Reserve, home to almost 300 acres of protected land. Yaka and Kuasi trees add sturdy timber to the scenery. Trails roam around the plush greenery and open up to remarkable views of the rolling mountains. You can venture high enough into the sky that occasionally clouds pass through the trees. Streams meander through the forest grounds and tumble into sensational waterfalls. The endangered Fijian ground frog hides in the jungle underbrush. Once thought eradicated during the colonial period of the 19th century, the ground frog population persists. The frog can grow to over four inches and have a multi-colored hue in their youth.

dayInfo.title: Savusavu – Trailing the South Pacfic
dayInfo.description: The natural splendor around Savusavu reaches from the rainforest to the reef, shimmering with emerald trees and pastel coral. Today you are free to enjoy the varied activities around the island, from lounging poolside to SCUBA diving minutes away from the marina. The J Hunter Pearl Farm takes you out into the glassy waters around the island to witness the different stages of pearl oysters stretching out across 660 feet of line more than 15 feet below the ocean’s surface. Once aboard the boat you welcome the cool flowing breeze. The water mists into the air providing a semi-sweet fragrance around your tour. See beneath the water on a glass-bottom boat or dip into the temperate waters to snorkel around the oyster farm. The farmers and your guides check on the oysters daily to ensure health of each individual oyster on the farm. In the spring and autumn, the oysters are harvested for pearls, where the small round ball glistens like glass in the sunlight.

dayInfo.title: Savusavu – Ultimate Relaxation
dayInfo.description: The kids are up and eager to join the fun at the children’s program once more. At breakfast, they fill you in on all the activities they have done, from making traditional art to snorkeling around exuberant fish. The kids eat rambutans like candy, and you are happy to see them eat fruit with such enthusiasm. The kids run off to join their new friends, and you spend the day at your leisure indulging in the luxuries of the island. Four-wheel drive around the island and visit Nukubolu village situated in the mountains, or you could grab the kids and venture on a dolphin encounter. Your transfer will meet you at the hotel and take you to a secluded marina across the island. A small boat awaits you, wading in the serene water. Your skipper takes you out to the deep water where pods are known to play. Suddenly a single dolphin pops its head out of the water. It clicks its tongue and laughs at the boat. Other dolphins start to arch and jump in the boats wake. Spinner dolphins can grow up to seven and half feet long. Their playful nature leads them to shoot out of the water and twist their bodies in the air, performing stunning acrobatics that wows the entire family. When the boat heads back to shore, you can see the emerald mountains rising above the turquoise water.

dayInfo.title: Viti Levu – Departure
dayInfo.description: At breakfast the family enjoys their final meal, filling their plates with the exotic fruits found fresh across the island. The kids do their best dolphin impressions from yesterday’s excursion, reenacting the twists and turns, along with the playful sounds that emanated from the waters. After your meal, you will return to Viti Levu for your flight home. You have traversed rainforests and mountains, traveled across pristine waters and slid down waterfalls. As you make your way home you know it was a vacation to remember, filled with adventure, relaxation, wonder, and family.

tourName: Fiji Vacation for Solo Travelers
placesVisited: Viti Levu, Nadi, Sigatoka, Navala, Beqa Lagoon, Luatoka, Mamanuca Islands
generalInfo: Fiji has been called nirvana for its emerald tropical rainforests bordered by shimmering indigo waters. Village children wave at you and sport gigantic smiles. Fish glow as bright as the coral. Windsurfers glide across gentle bays. Your custom tailored Fiji vacation for solo travelers, offers you the freedom to enjoy adventure and splendor cast across the diverse landscape of Viti Levu. Visit remote villages and course through the forest on the back of whitewater. Your days will be filled with as much excitement and relaxation as you prefer, mingled with the unparalleled gregariousness of Fijian life.

dayInfo.title: Destination Paradise
dayInfo.description: The island nation of Fiji is a collection of over 320 islands dotting the South Pacific. The water glows indigo against palm-fringed beaches. Vibrant-hued fish swim around the rainbow-colored reefs. Locals are known as some of the friendliest people on earth, always sharing fabulous smiles and eager to help. The sun beats warm on the tropical rainforests and expands across the powdery shores. You arrive at Nadi International Airport on the large island of Viti Levu where your private transfer is waiting. Your escort takes you to a splendid resort with a panorama of the ocean. The aroma of sugar cane sweeps across the tall grasses. In the distance, you can see the towering peak of Mount Tomanivi, an extinct volcano standing 4,344 feet above sea level. Near the shoreline, the scent of coconut oil blends with the sea. You immediately feel safe in the welcoming atmosphere of Pacific paradise. The sounds of an exotic guitar accompany a light rhythm of drums. Tiki torches light the walkways of your resort encircling the pool and leading down to the resort. The resort is filled with similar travelers, straying away from family friendly and couples-styled grounds. You have just arrived, and already the island is everything you dreamed it could be.

dayInfo.title: Beach Combing
dayInfo.description: In the morning, you can hear the light brushing of the sea against the sand. At breakfast, you find an array of exotic fruits brightening the morning meal. The aroma of tropical pineapple is matched by its sensational yellow color. Your table is filled with like-minded travelers in search of a stunning tropical getaway. Everyone exudes island life, taking the day as it comes, relaxing into the pleasures of paradise, and greeting one another with “Bula!” You bite into the pineapple and find a fresh sweetness. After your meal, you venture to Natadola, considered the nicest beach on the entire island. When you arrive at the beach, you find an expanse of white sand sliding in azure water. The sun reflects off of the surface and brings a gemlike quality to the ocean. The trees rustle in the seaside breeze bringing a refreshing coolness, and carrying a touch of mist. You dig your toes into the powdery sand feeling the warmth fold over your feet. Near the edge of the bay, small waves break. On the outside of the bay, you can see surfers careening down waves with impressive grace. You can lie out under the sun or dip your toes into the ocean.

dayInfo.title: Meeting the Raft
dayInfo.description: The wonders of Fiji are endless, no more prevalent than on the island of Viti Levu. Wake up to the view of fringed palms and glistening ocean. At breakfast, people once again greet one another with “Bula!,” the traditional Fijian greeting standing in for “Hello,” but with a more of a personal connection to it. Your guide meets you in the resort lobby ready to take you up into the island highlands. You arrive at the banks of the Navua River. The other rafting participants have wide, bright smiles, immediately introducing themselves before expressing how excited they are. You quickly feel at ease and are equally excited for the rafting trip. The Navua River begins on the southeast slope of Mount Gordon and meanders through the lush rainforest 40 miles until reaching the southern coast. You step onto the raft, take your position, and shove off from the riverbanks letting the current take you. The scent of verdant soil drifts around the river. Parrots add life to the treetops with vibrant calls and glamorous color. The cold water splashes against your cheeks when you paddle. You can hear the river rushing against the surrounding landscape. Sunlight pokes through the jade canopy overhead. The banks rise into rugged cliffs, smoothed by sporadic waterfalls beading into the river. Your guide tells you to get into position. You can hear the whitewater before you see it, sloping downwards rushing around boulders with vigor. You heart beats with excitement. You hold onto you oar and help propel the raft.

dayInfo.title: Beauty of the Canopy
dayInfo.description: The beach has a limitless allure, filled with shimmering water and lined with cool sand in the morning light. The trees in the upper rainforest maintain as much island flavor as the beaches of Viti Levu. Your guide meets you in the lobby, escorting you back into the rainforest, directing your gaze into the trees. You venture up into the canopy and are fitted for your thrilling zipline adventure. You hear the rush of the river below. The lines can carry you up to a distance of 512 feet between platforms, and over a total area almost a mile long. Your pulse is racing. Collared lorries linger in the branches nearby watching with interest. Their radiant red plumage stands out against the emerald leaves. You leap from the platform feeling the wind gust past. The trees turn into a blur. The collard lorries disappear. You slow down when you near the next platform. You take in your surroundings once again, this time with a completely different perspective. Even though the trees are just as beautiful, the river as crisp, the air as warm, it all looks more vivid.

dayInfo.title: Subaquatic Freedom
dayInfo.description: When you wake up in the morning, you breathe in the lingering aroma of coconut and remember the freedom you on your getaway to Fiji. Your guide meets you early in the morning and takes you to Pacific Harbour where you find your boat waiting. You step aboard the 35-foot hydrofoil designed to provide a comfortable ride and create a minimal output draft. When you arrive at the dive site, you follow your guide into the water without a second thought. The site is near Beqa Lagoon, known for its submarine visibility up to 92 feet and the warm temperature of the water. You follow your guide below the water’s surface near the drop off ledge of Beqa Passage around 100 feet deep. The water turns to a rich cobalt blue. You move slightly with the current before your guide points at a nearby shark. The bull shark is a true highlight of any diver’s experience, especially in Fiji. They can grow to almost eight feet long and weigh up to 290 pounds. They have a gray upper layer and a white underbelly. When the massive shark swims in the area, your heart can’t help but race. You quickly see the animal’s magnetism all around you in the elegant and purposeful movement of the bull shark. Soon your guide gives you the signal, and you venture to a higher depth in search of more sensational shark life.

dayInfo.title: Embracing Culture
dayInfo.description: Today you will leave the sandy beach and make your way to the Nausori Highlands. The dense rainforest of the eastern highlands is a memory, replaced by a sweeping panorama of verdant ridges. Pale, green hills turn into ribbed mountains set behind remote villages. Navala is nestled in the mountains with picture-perfect traditional thatched bures , huts, in the foreground. The bures form pristine avenues wrapped around a central promenade leading to the banks of the Ba River. Some plain rectangular houses have timber poles and bamboo walls. Before wandering around the village, you ask the first person you see to take you to the turaga-ni-koro , the village chief. The villagers smile at you and bid you a pleasant morning. You see one woman doing the washing, hanging a brilliant canary yellow sarong on a clothesline. The traditions of the village are rooted deep in the heritage of the island making the villagers proud to be in touch with their culture.

dayInfo.title: Capturing Colors
dayInfo.description: In the morning, you look out on the water and understandably want to spend more time basking in the splendor of the island. After breakfast, you head to the island’s northern reaches, past the sweet blissful scent of sugar cane, to find the small island of Nananu-i-ra. The pocket-sized landmass is over one square mile of rolling hills encompassed by ridged bays. White sands shine in the midmorning sunlight and mangroves cast shade over the shoreline. You notice kiteboarders skimming across the sea. Their kite catches the breeze and carries the boarder into the air. The reef almost breaches the water in some areas off of the island. The hard coral builds over limestone outcroppings with wondrous pigment. The archipelago is known as “The Soft Coral Capital of the World,” which is notable when the current flows and causes the coral to wave like an entire forest rippling in the wind. A marvelous blue sea star clasps the rocks, emblematic of the colors found along the reef. Angelfish hide in the coral swimming in and out of countless crevices. The underwater world is filled with colorful splendor, brimming with the fish, the coral, and the awesome visibility provided by the gentle bay.

dayInfo.title: Freedom to Move
dayInfo.description: In the morning light, the palm trees frame your view of the ocean. You take a morning walk on the beach to linger in the beauty of the island and the memories of how much you have done and seen since you arrived. At breakfast, you share stories with other travelers. You bite into a sweet and slightly sour rambutan. The smell of fresh coconuts is soothing. Your private transfer will escort you to Nadi International Airport for your flight home. Soon you will watch the islands fade into the distance below the clouds; but you could always stay a while, traveling to one of the other treasured tropical islands across the archipelago. The freedom of solo-traveling and the beauty of Fiji are an unbeatable combination. You may want to read the Fiji travel reviews for trip extension ideas.

tourName: Fiji Vacation in Vanua Levu Island at the Award Winning Namale Resort & Spa
placesVisited: Vanua Levu, Namale Resort and Spa
generalInfo: The endless bliss of an island paradise is yours to discover on this custom tailored tour of the Fijian island of Vanua Levu, and at the award-winning Namale Resort and Spa. From endless romantic seclusion to majestic coral reefs, tropical rainforest waterfalls to Fijian villages bubbling with tradition, you will find true romance and natural wonder. Indulge in a sensual spa that overlooks the turquoise hued sea and taste exotic local fruits such as rambutan. Enjoy the unique experience that brings you the delicate combination of relaxation and adventure making sure that your time in Fiji will be nothing less than heavenly.

dayInfo.title: Gateway to Exclusive Getaway
dayInfo.description: Welcome to Vanua Levu, the second largest of the Fijian isles but an overwhelmingly hidden pearl of the South Pacific. Arrive at the airport and be met by a semi-private transfer that will deliver you to the inspiring lobby of Namale Resort and Spa, Fiji’s top rated getaway. En route to your fabulous accommodation it is impossible not to notice the serene natural beauty of the island. The water is a calm turquoise that leads to the horizon. Palm trees twist and rise over the sandy shores. The peaceful atmosphere surrounds the island in a lush blanket of landscape. The island is filled with culture, graced by time, giving essence to the surrounding villages outside of the capital city of Savusavu. The city itself looks more like a dreamy port town set against the backdrop of a sweetly aromatic bay and surrounded by lush jungle hills that are alive with the fragrance of hibiscus. Arrive at Namale Resort and Spa, a place that will bring paradise to you, with every amenity well within reach. Once inside your room you can pop open the champagne that has been waiting for you and sip on a luscious cheers to paradise. From the luxurious lodgings to secluded pools that overlook the calm Koro Sea, you will settle in, unwind, and begin to revel in paradise.

dayInfo.title: The Jungle’s Allure
dayInfo.description: The morning brings a shimmer to the cobalt water that stretches over the shore. You wake to the gentle sound of lolling waves and a soft breeze combing through the trees. Enjoy your breakfast in the comfortable privacy of your room overlooking the early light reflecting on the morning sea. The plates are bursting with a rainbow of local fresh fruit, from creamy white coconut to bright red rambutan with a sweet, jelly-like interior and a skin that looks like a something from the sea. After your meal you will venture out onto the island at your whim and pleasure, exploring the secluded paradise that has already captured more than just your imagination. With the day at your leisure you can venture into a fabulous jungle excursion to scour the local flora and fauna through the remarkable natural landscape that brings the image of the South Pacific to life. You can begin your journey into the trees; the air is filled with the aromatics of vibrant rainforest, from lush leaves to rich earth, and the sounds of vivacious birds. You will come to the first set of three waterfalls known as Tavoro Waterfalls. The first is over 74 feet high with a long powerful burst of water spilling through the encompassing greenery. A long stroll through the jungle will bring you to the second falls, the hike making you feel as though you are an adventurer looking for a forgotten city. Grab the rope and slowly make your way through the wading river, and onto the secluded grandeur of the flowing cascade. The third falls is smaller but no less splendid, surrounded by a large pool where, if you happen to have brought goggles and snorkel, you can look to the aquatic floor and find tremendous prawns going about their day. At dinner you will indulge in a five-course meal prepared by celebrated Chef Joeli, and served in the location of your preference, whether within the dining room, a private seaside cave, or even a romantic table set on the beach looking out to the sunset.

dayInfo.title: The Culture of the Sea
dayInfo.description: It has never been easier to wake up in the morning knowing that no matter what you choose to do during the day it will be the perfect choice. Once again you can enjoy the delights of breakfast in the location of your choice, whether beneath the shade of your poolside terrace or once again overlooking the glistening color of the morning sea. The consistency of the warm and embracing tropical climate makes today, and everyday, a perfect time to venture out into the water to discover some of the truly majestic reefs of Vanua Levu, beginning with the famous Namena Marine Reserve. The small island of Namenalala off of the southwest shore of Savusavu showcases the soft coral and the sensational biodiversity of the reef. The coral is magnificent, almost like neon in its vibrancy and glowing within the luminous water. Fish pour from the reef, swimming in and out of the aquatic forest, ranging from those that are marvelously colored to those that are wildly decorated with zebra-like stripes. You may even see a sea turtle or two. In the evening, the majesty beneath the waves is accompanied by the cultural sounds as you experience a traditional Fijian experience with a look into village life.

dayInfo.title: A Paradisiacal Day
dayInfo.description: Let the morning wash over the sea before you venture out into another island day. The sweet aromas of breakfast are at your whim and command once more. The day is at your leisure, filled with endless possibility and the wonders of Namale Resort and the island. Whether you choose to visit Kioa, a small island off of Vanua Levu settled by Polynesian islanders in the late 1940’s, or decide to relax on the beach with the sun wrapped around your shoulders, the day is yours to do as much or as little as you’d like. For a relaxing day you could always have a blissful visit at Namale’s award-winning spa. You find the luxurious center set on a volcanic cliff where the scent of palm is not only encompassing but also soothing. Whether you partake in the relaxing treatments alone or coupled-up in comfort, you can look out over the ocean as you feel the relaxing oils rub into your shoulders and back. The secluded panorama combined with lavish touches creates a pristine environment. Until December 2015 you can receive a $200 (Fijian Dollar) credit toward the resort and indulge in a tranquil day at the spa.

dayInfo.title: Beauty and Tradition
dayInfo.description: Whether you let the soft sound of the rustling leaves wake you or you have already stepped outside into what has likely become a daily ritual of walking along the immaculate shore, the morning comes and readies you for a day of exploration through the island’s wonders. Naag Mandir Temple is a colorful display of architecture and religion. Within the Indian-styled structure you will find Cobra Rock, a nine-foot high boulder that resembles its reptilian namesake and which locals claim has grown larger throughout the years. The nape of the stone is constantly covered with garlands and coconut cream, known as lolo , and fruit is laid at the rock’s base as an offering. In the evening you will find the weekly gathering of local villagers at Namale. The people come wearing traditional dress, such as long grass skirts that are belted with colorful greenery or draping leaves; however, the style has evolved with time to include flowing Polynesian textiles as well. When the music begins the beat and string is more than a historic offering of traditional dancing but local history told through song. Each week local villagers come to Namale to share their history through narrative dance. The pulsing drums continue to create a rhythmic ambiance filled with mesmerizing voices and captivating narratives, surrounded by the flicker of a comforting fire. Sitting beneath the starlight, these come to be the most remarkable stories you have ever heard.

dayInfo.title: Hills and Sunken Valleys
dayInfo.description: In the early morning of the day you can find the sunlight peaking over the eastern horizon and bringing the turquoise water to glistening life. The days can be as active or as relaxing as you prefer, spent strolling along villages or swimming in the sea. For a remarkable morning filled with an elegant view of the island, you can venture to Des Voeux Peak, the island’s second highest mountain standing at 3,585 feet tall. Set out beneath the canopy of the trees where you can listen to the harmony of the early morning risers; the regal blue and yellow Kingfisher sing in the coming sunlight. The sun soon hits its zenith and you are standing on the summit of Des Voeux Peak looking out over the crystal clear day. The lush greenery slopes down to the seaside, mixing the colors that have become abundant and embracing, unable to dispel their luster. You can even look into the old volcanic crater that has become Lake Tagimaucia, where you may even be able to see the colors of the rare tagimaucia flower, Fiji’s national flora, blossoming in high altitudes in the latter months of the year. As the sun begins to drift behind the horizon you will delight in a secret dining location, an experience offered to you only by the gracious Namale resort. The remarkable setting brings an indelible ambience to your meal, and Namale will make certain that your dinner will be unforgettable, whether sitting beside spouting water near the island’s inspiring blowhole, or enjoying the view of the coastline on a sunset cruise, your secret location will ensure a fantastic end to a fabulous day.

dayInfo.title: The Local Brilliance
dayInfo.description: From the coastline to the tree line, you have adventured through the sensational landscape of the island, but you can always find more splendors along the way. After breakfast the day is meant for you to enjoy the sunlight and sand, the trees and the tastes, in whatever way you desire. Today might be just the day to venture around the island to experience the local villages and the artistry of the island. The scent of coconut oil is captivating and glamorous while the tapestries and wood-carved sculptures are alluring and striking; woodcarving continues to be an illustrious trade of the Fijian Islands. If you prefer to set out on another relaxing journey through the island you can jump onto a paddleboard and slide along the glossy surface of Koro Bay or float in the saltwater river with the cool touch of the mountain water rushing against your skin. The island is filled with endless possibilities that will make your heart strum with energy. In the evening you will find yourself celebrating with the grandiose flavors of the island in your final five-course dinner of your island getaway.

dayInfo.title: Continuing Bliss
dayInfo.description: There is a sweetness to the morning that comes from more than just the treasured local fruits that have continuously filled your breakfast plate over the past few days. The sun looks brighter and the greenery feels lusher. The island is as peaceful as ever, filled with the unparalleled landscape that has kept the natural colors of the flowers and trees, water and birds brimming with effervescence. Today you will have a semi-private transfer to the airport where you will begin your journey homeward. It is not often that one can say they have found paradise, but in a resort called Namale on the Fijian Island of Vanua Levu, you can easily say that you have. For other tour options, read the reviews for Fiji tour agents .

tourName: Fiji Vacation Tour: Viti Levu, Nadi Town, Pacific Harbour, Suva & Rakiraki
placesVisited: Suva, Pacific Harbour, Nadi Town, Rakiraki, Viti Levu
generalInfo: When you think of tropical rainforest and crystal waters, your mind should instantly turn to Fiji. This 8-day exotic Fiji vacation tour through Viti Levu, Nadi Town, Pacific Harbour, Suva and Rakiraki balances relaxation and exhilaration. Whether you dream of adrenaline filled getaways or want the soft sand between your toes, yearn the rush of whitewater or love jungle emerald trees, you will find it in on the big island of Viti Levu. Go kiteboarding or relish a quiet moment by the pool; plunge down rapids on the Navua River or enjoy a calm rainforest hike. Fiji has it all, ready to be discovered on the country’s largest island.

dayInfo.title: Nadi Town - Big Island Bula
dayInfo.description: Arrive on Viti Levu and find a combination of dense tropical rainforest and shimmering azure coastal waters. Beaches shine gold and white from the sand. People smile and wave offering you a traditional Bula! The greeting means hello, but also contains much more feeling and connection. Your private transfer, arranged for by one of Zicasso's travel agents for Fiji , meets you at the airport and escorts you to your resort style accommodation located near Nadi Town. Viti Levu is the largest of the Fijian islands with 4,011 square miles of surface area. The island contains dramatic sand dunes around the shore. Magnificent tiger sharks roam in the deep water, and exotic birds soar through the jungle canopy. After you settle into your hotel, the day is yours to explore and delight in the island. The Sigatoka Sand Dunes are located at the mouth of Sigatoka River, where the water meets the ocean the dunes cover over 1,600 acres of land. When you arrive you can see the golden sand rolling along the riverside ranging from 66 to almost 200 feet tall. The wind brushes the sand to create weaving strokes across the sloping landscape. You can hear the ocean lapping onto the shore on the other side of the sandy hills. The dunes are exceptional, filled with splendor stemming from the grainy sand and sheer magnitude of the entire area.

dayInfo.title: Nadi Town - Local Luster
dayInfo.description: In the morning the island is peaceful. Small waves lull against the shore; the lapping rush of the water offers a soothing wake up call. The sunrise carries over the eastern edge of the island, rising over verdantly forested mountains. Breakfast is a collection of fruits, exotic to you but common to the island. You find a rambutan, with a red outer layer billowing with soft spindles. You tear it open to find a pale pink interior filled with a satisfying sweetness similar to a lychee. After breakfast, you are taken to Kula Eco Park, a wildlife sanctuary opened in 1997 and showcasing the native animals from around the archipelago. Fringed fronds dangle from palm trees arching over the walkways. The rainforest encompasses the park providing comfortable shade. The walkways circumvent the rainforest connected in some areas by hanging bridges. You find the majesty of Fiji as much on the beaches as you do underneath the canopy. Flying foxes hang like the leaves, upside down and comfortable in their habitat. Kula parrots squawk as you pass them by. Their real name is the collared lorry. They grow up to eight inches long and have scarlet cheeks and bright green wings. Their colorful plumage reminds you of the array of fruits at breakfast, emblematic of a tropical paradise.

dayInfo.title: Pacific Harbour - Adventure in the Gorge
dayInfo.description: After your meal, your private transfer meets you in the hotel lobby to take you along Queens Road to Pacific Harbour. The area is known as the “Adventure Capital” of Fiji, offering range of activities that can keep the heart rate pumping or calming, depending on your preference. Your guide escorts you to the banks of the Navua River. The waterway flows around 40 miles from the eastern slope of Mount Gordon to the south coast. For a more tranquil experience you can step onto a bilibili, a traditional raft of lashed-together bamboo and steered by a single person using a large, sturdy pole. If you choose to indulge in the adventure, you step aboard a durable raft for a whitewater excursion you will never forget along class-three rapids. The current soon takes you, and the gorge rises around you. The air is scented with granite and freshwater. The rocks are smoothed from time and the elements. Trees border the canyon walls. Waterfalls glide down the cliffs and flanking craggy walls. When the rush of whitewater begins you listen to your guide and paddle. The water splashes upwards and you feel the cold mist against your face. The raft thrusts left and right, up and down before settling into the gentle current once more, your laughter and the distancing crash of the whitewater fading.

dayInfo.title: Pacific Harbour - Canopy Cruise
dayInfo.description: The morning around Pacific Harbour lends itself to the calls of the forest. Rambunctious parrots twitter in the treetops. At the same time the wake of the ocean brushes against the golden sand. After breakfast you visit the Arts Village, home to craftspeople that specialize in traditional Fijian artistry. Soon your guide meets you to once again take you into the rainforest, this time venturing into the canopy. You will traverse the treetops and the mountainside along eight different lines. When you come to the first line, your guide connects and thoroughly checks the straps. The lush rainforest surrounds you. You can see the second platform nearby, standing on the other side of the Wainadoi River Valley. You leap from the platform and are effortlessly soaring through the canopy. The wind brushes your hair. Trees flash past. You take a moment to notice the exceptional view zooming by. Various types of trees reach out around you. The emerald leaves shimmer. Water rushes around the valley floor. When you reach the next platform, you take a long, excited breath, ready to go again.

dayInfo.title: Suva - Nation’s Capital
dayInfo.description: Today you leave behind the adventures of Pacific Harbour and make your way along the coastline to the capital city of Suva. The Fijian capital is home to approximately half of the entire urban population and is the largest city in the Pacific outside of Auckland, New Zealand. University students stroll around the lush parks situated near the water. The harbor is filled as much with yachts as with fishing boats. Palm trees line the beaches and wide-lane streets. Locals and visitors lounge in restaurants along Victoria Parade. Downtown is a collection of colonial buildings dating back to the British, contemporary shopping plazas, and a luxurious ocean aroma sweeping in across the esplanade. The hills bordering the city expound with trees and pretty suburban homes with a view of the bay. The city claims home to the Fiji Museum, located in Thurston Gardens. The museum houses a collection of extensive archeological Fijian findings dating back 3,700 years. The displays are best viewed circling clockwise around the gallery, beginning from behind the ticket counter. Pearl-white displays help emphasize the rich wooden tones or colorful structures of each relic. Cannibal forks reach out from a platform, sturdy in their design, and captivating in their presentation. One of the last double-hulled canoes sits in the center of the gallery reaching a length of over 44 feet. The elegance and power of each relic connote the history and heritage of the archipelago.

dayInfo.title: Suva - Natural Countenance
dayInfo.description: The morning takes you along the Kings Road en route to Rakiraki. The pathway winds around Viti Levu Bay showcasing the stunning azure water and emerald trees at the island’s northernmost point. The ridged mountains of the Nakauvadra Range separate the Rakiraki from the rest of the island. Kings Road follows Wainibuka River, the water slowly coursing around the hills and vibrant trees. The town of Vaileka has a predominantly Indian population that combines the culture brought with British colonial force, with Fijian island heritage. The Penang Sugar Mill opened in the 19th century and is now owned by the Fiji government. Settle into your tremendous resort lodgings where you can watch the kiteboarders glide across the waves. The South Easterly trade winds drape over crystal clear water. You see people holding onto kites jumping from a small wave, and floating in the air, twirling or just returning back down to the water before doing it all again. The sand along the beach is windswept and comfortable, slightly sloping into the water. Rocks and boulders line the outer reaches of the resort shores. Hammocks sway in the trees offering a perfect spot to sit back and relax in the island beauty.

dayInfo.title: Suva - Island Freedom
dayInfo.description: Wake up to the cool breeze of the South Easterly trade winds filled with the succulent aromas of breakfast. The day is yours to explore the northern shores or relax pool and beachside as you please. Journey along the Pacific for an indelible fishing expedition or visit an unforgettable Fijian village for a deeper connection with the island’s locals. Board a vessel spanning a length of almost 33 feet and make your way into open water. The sea mist splashes your face with a refreshing cool. The sun drifts overhead reflecting off of the water. You don the gear, putting on the wetsuit and tanks and follow your guide into the water. Fiji has exceptional diving sites you don’t want to miss, especially situated near Rakiraki, whether you are an experienced diver or a taking a course for the first time. Shark Reef burst with fish, large and small, but is most notable for the eight different types of sharks that inhabit the area. Your guides are incredibly trained to take you through the opulent water. Over 1,200 varieties of fish swim around the reefs near the islands.

dayInfo.title: Suva - Adventurous Returns
dayInfo.description: Fiji’s northern coast is has taken you off of the beaten path, visiting with sharks and locals, with a background view of the stunning pleated mountains. You revel in your last breakfast on the islands, taking in the exotic flavors of rambutan and pomelo once more, even indulging in the creamy sweetness of the local bananas. Your private transfer meets you at the hotel after breakfast to escort you back to Nadi. En route, you pass Yaqara Cattle Ranch, the source of celebrated Fiji Water. You pass through the predominantly Indian towns of Tavua and Ba, and arrive at the airport for your return flight home. The big island of Viti Levu has taken you on even bigger adventures, showing you the welcoming traditions and celebrated life across the island.

tourName: Luxury Fiji Vacation for Couples: Seclusion in Paradise
placesVisited: Nadi, Denarau Island, Mamanuca Islands, Yasawa Islands
generalInfo: Picture strolling alongside crystal clear ocean water, walking on powdery white sand, listening to the soothing rush of the current while holding your partner’s hand. Your custom tailored luxury Fiji vacation for couples was created for romance and seclusion in paradise. Explore pristine coral reefs that nourish the senses and enjoy a candlelit dinner on the beach. Watch the sunset while sailing around the archipelago and listen to the rhythmic songs of distant villages. Passion blossoms and endures along these shores.

dayInfo.title: Beginning Savoring of Comfort
dayInfo.description: Viti Levu is the largest of the Fijian islands, home to the country’s capital city and the shimmering Coral Coast. The palm trees sway in the early morning breeze, and you find the tropical aromas of palm oil and coconut always present. Sand dunes line part of the coast separating the water from the jungle trees. Tiger sharks swim gracefully and grandly in the depths of the South Pacific waters. Your private transfer meets you at the airport escorting you around the early markets and bustling streets of Nadi Town. You arrive at your luxurious resort on Denarau Island, a landmass of less than one square mile connected to Viti Levu. The pool sparkles pure bright blue with an infinity effect that makes the pool edge look like it touches the ocean. Comfortable cabanas provide shade beyond the large palm trees. Your room offers a sensational ocean view, filled with the enticing salty sea air. The powdery sand lines the shore and the tranquil breeze drifts around the waters. You settle into the effortless comforts of the resort and the pure majesty of the island perfect for romance.

dayInfo.title: Leisure Exploration
dayInfo.description: The sunlight peeks over the eastern horizon, shining above the length of rainforest trees and exotic fringed palm leaves. At breakfast, fruits practically glow in season. Watermelons are bright red. Pineapples shine canary yellow. Bananas are creamy and rich. Each piece is juicier and sweeter than the last, tasting more like dessert than a side of fruit. The day is yours to experience the surrounding wonders of Denarau Island and Viti Levu at your leisure. Sugarcane plantations speckle the island around Lautoka, and the lush mountains cast shadows over the valley in the background. The town known as Sugar City situated through the pass of the Sabeto Mountains. Lautoka is the second largest city in Fiji and is situated among the heart of the sugar cane region. The sweet aroma drifts around the town as locals stand at streetside carts and grind loose bushels into a sweet and refreshing drink. Foliage dangles over the wide streets. A picturesque esplanade offers a delightful stroll alongside local shops. Mount Evans lingers over the town borders reminding you of the limits of urbanization and the exemplary beauty of untouched nature.

dayInfo.title: Cultural Combination
dayInfo.description: The small wake brushes against the golden shore adding a gentle rush to the morning. Breakfast is filled with the vibrant colors of more exotic fruits, from the fading magenta layers of rambutan to the inner flashy orange of a papaya. After your meal you can settle into a cabana and enjoy the soft breeze poolside, or venture into Nadi and its bustling streets to experience the local lifestyle around the largest Hindu temple outside of India. Sri Siva Subramaniya Sawmi Temple stands at the base of Main Street, quietly but dramatically situated away from the energetic artisan shops of town. The architecture brims with traditional Dravidian technique apparent in the concentrically layered tower. Exuberant colors decorate the façade reminding you of the endless rainbow of the tropical fruits at breakfast. The building pops against the cloudless blue sky. Hindu deities carved from wood were brought from India to help dress the temple. Frescoes line the main gallery, draped across the walls and ceiling. The temple creates a culture separate from the South Pacific music and images you expected. Locals embrace the temple and the culture, ingratiating itself into the Fijian culture behind kava ceremonies and a traditional meke .

dayInfo.title: Idyllic Islands
dayInfo.description: The nights are graced with the aromas of fresh seafood steamed in banana leaves, simmering in butter. The mornings are sweet with pomelo, a cross between a blood orange a grapefruit that offers a refreshing citrus flavor. After breakfast, your private transfer meets you in the hotel lobby and takes you to the harbor for your high-speed catamaran to the Mamanuca Islands. Find yourself on a luxurious secluded resort situated in the shade of the jungle with an unparalleled view of the azure water. The beaches glisten with bleached white sand. Lush tropical forest carpets the towering volcanic cone that edges the resort. Opulent coral reefs sprout from the sea floor and magnify in the crystal clear water. The island is a paradise, secluded from other islands but close enough to view the rugged outlines of nearby archeological outcroppings.

dayInfo.title: Along the Reef’s Edge
dayInfo.description: The island is serene, closer to ethereal and paradisiacal. The sea air combines with the rich tree line to create a unique tropical scent you can’t help but adore. From your bedroom you can hear the water lap softly onto the beach. The day is yours to indulge in the luxuries of your secluded island paradise at your whim and leisure. The sand feels like a pillow beneath your feet, perfectly warm on your skin with a touch of brininess from the water. Grab a snorkel and goggles and float above the coral reef around the island for a closer look at the amazing subaquatic biosphere. The romance of the reef glows beneath the wake. Over 1,200 species of fish live in or around the calcite deposits, not to mention over 350 different types of hard coral that comprise the reef. The water is temperate and inviting, encompassing your body as you let the gentle current move you back and forth. Eyestripe Surgeonfish glide around the underwater forest with ease. They can grow up to 21 inches in length. A yellow stripe flashes across their eye. Their tail radiates blue with a neon yellow outline. It makes wide circles and requires plenty of space to swim. It is hard not to fall in love with the natural majesty of the coral reef.

dayInfo.title: Trip to Remember
dayInfo.description: Beyond the perfect sandy fringes of your isolated island is more of the elegant paradise for you to explore. You can choose to stay on the sand and wiggle your toes in the water or discover new adventures along the archipelago; you can even do both in a single day. You see a group standing near a large, thin palm towering in the air. A local guide is attached to the trunk climbing towards the fronds. The guide uses the edges of his palms to stable himself before leaping upwards, catching the tree trunk with his feet and pressing the edge of his hands to the bark once more. He reaches a green coconut, descends the tree, grabs a machete, and carves open the fruit. The entire display took less than five minutes. You taste the creamy, semi-sweet flavor of the pure coconut milk. The coconut itself is heavy, weighing up to three pounds. People begin to play beach volleyball, kicking up sand and reveling in the pristine sunshine kissing their skin. When you board the boat mid afternoon the wonders of the scenery are already apparent. The lush greenery bursts out of the azure waters to create a beautiful contrast in color. The boat casts off and the wind brushes your hair, bringing a new panorama to enjoy.

dayInfo.title: Champagne Islands
dayInfo.description: In the morning, you can see people stepping out into the water with paddleboats, delighting in the mist and the breeze. Spend time indulging the flavors of breakfast and the soft sand. With the day at your pleasure there are endless opportunities to explore or relax. You can join an island-hopping cruise that will take you away from your own private resort for the day, combing the beaches of the Sacred Islands and the Mamanuca archipelago. The catamaran sets out along the turquoise waters. The color is glossy ranging from bright to dark. North of your resort you come to the important islands thought to be the first of the Fijian lands to rise out of the waters around 2,000 years ago. The uninhabited islands are surrounded by reefs and glistening with greenery. Your guide tells you tales of the islands, recounting stories about ghosts and warriors. When you walk through the island center, you can see remnants of Fijian ancestry, indications of their lives, areas where they cooked. The landscape is intense both in its ruggedness and beauty. When you return to the ship you are handed a glass of champagne where you settle onto the deck and watch the islands pass by.

dayInfo.title: Depths of Wonder
dayInfo.description: A glass-bottom boat takes visitors out to the coral reef, showing those that prefer dry land to the open water the wonders of the world below. After breakfast, you can set out onto the glassy boat to view the reef or venture deeper into the water on a SCUBA excursion. With over 40 dive sites to visit you no experience will ever be the same. You put on the skintight wetsuit and jump into the water at the dive site. You follow your guide into the depths of the waters, watching the hard coral jut out from the rising hillside of reef in fan-like displays. Turtles soar through the water and can live up to 80 years old, laying up to 250 eggs a year in their prime. The Fijian islands are home to five of the seven species of sea turtle. The hawksbill weighs around 150 pounds with a sharp, pointed beak. They flap their fins like winds speeding through the waters around the reefs. Visitors rarely view the elegance of the turtle’s underwater flight. There is no mistaking the ardent pleasures of Fiji’s natural wonders.

dayInfo.title: Relaxing Together
dayInfo.description: Few things are more soothing than the sound of smooth water brushing against a perfect beach. After breakfast, the day is once again yours to revel in your surroundings. The forest canopy hides walking trails and the poolside cabanas are always welcoming. You and your partner venture to the spa to spend time relaxing in the pristine scenery with the calming effects of a massage. A thatched roof covers the open gazebo where you find two massage beds waiting. The breeze rustles through the opening offering a sensual brush against your skin. The clear water shifts from azure to cobalt along the horizon. The rich wood is an organic look against the backdrop of stunning landscape and shoreline. The scent of coconut oil lingers in the air before you feel the slightly cool lubricant help loosen your mussels, providing an extra indulgence in the already exemplary experience.

dayInfo.title: Cast Away
dayInfo.description: The morning casts a shimmer across the azure waters reaching up to your room. At breakfast, you savor the unique flavor of the pomelo. Your final day is yours to discover the treasures of the island and its surroundings, whether finding a pearl of relaxation on the beach or adventuring on another snorkel excursion to witness the celebrated coral reefs once more. Monuriki is the famous island Tom Hanks found himself stranded on in the film Cast Away. Emerald flora sprouts from the soil and overtakes the rugged cliffs. The island is less than 100 acres and reaches a height of 584 feet. The uninhabited islet is also home to the endangered Fiji Crested Iguana. A coral reef surrounds the beaches, adorned with volcanic rock and deep lagoons. The iguana can grow to a length of 30 inches, with flashes of white stripes across its fluorescent green skin. They hide from the sun beneath the shade and sunbathe on the rocks in cooler weather. Monuriki Island allows you to explore as a couple, seeking out an adventure on a nearby landscape, yet returning to your secluded getaway to take advantage of the remaining day.

dayInfo.title: Endless Samplings
dayInfo.description: The sound of lapping waves is bittersweet on your final morning on the island. The overwhelming beauty and privacy of the resort has offered you ample time to explore and relax with your partner: spending every moment sampling the majesty of the Fiji, from the food to the forests, the coral to the fish, pampering your mind, body, soul, and relationship. Your private transfer meets you in the hotel lobby and escorts you to the high-speed catamaran departing for Port Denarau before arriving at the Nadi International Airport. You have sampled the luxurious of Fiji; it is only natural want to stay longer and have more. Visit Zicasso's vacation packages to Fiji page for more itinerary planning ideas.

tourName: Perfect Honeymoon in Fiji: Romance & Relaxation in Paradise
generalInfo: Your Fiji honeymoon includes lounging in the warm sun on you private deck while overlooking the picturesque beach of your tropical paradise. Your custom tailored tour of Fiji opens up the romance of the exotic landscape for honeymoons, getaways, and couples in search of dreamlike wonder. Feel the breeze sweep off of the ocean and rustle through the tall palm trees. Spend quality time with your partner against a backdrop of sensational coral reefs glowing beneath an indigo ocean. Dine under the stars and delight on the fresh, elegant cuisine of your secluded resort. Romance is waiting for you in Fiji.

dayInfo.title: Viti Levu – Island Perfection
dayInfo.description: Fiji is a collection of lush, tropical islands bordered by vibrant coral reefs and surrounded by the iridescent indigo South Pacific. You arrive at the airport on Viti Levu, the largest island in the archipelago of approximately 320 islands. Your private transfer, arranged by our Fiji tour operators , meets you at the airport. You will be escorted along the Coral Coast to your private resort in the town of Sigatoka. The aroma of palm trees and citrus fruits envelopes the air. Emerald leaves fill the sky draping the rolling hills and ascending the mountains. In Sigatoka, the trickle of the Sigatoka River filters into the soft current of the ocean brushing against the beach. The scent of palm trees gives way to the sweet fragrance of sugar cane from the plantations upriver. In the heart of town, people stroll through the street and enjoy the vibrant and friendly ambiance of the produce market. The fruits and vegetables shimmer like a coral reef encircled with a bright rind. You arrive at your opulent accommodation situated on the beach. Palm trees shade the relaxing 112-foot lagoon pool. Thatched roofs add character to the resort reminding you of the tropical atmosphere all around you. Locals and visitors alike greet one another with joyous smiles and a harmonious “Bula!” - a greeting that means hello, but also so much more. They are welcoming you to the island, to your resort, and to the secluded luxuries that await you.

dayInfo.title: Viti Levu – Revel in Paradise
dayInfo.description: In the morning, you wake up to the sunlight spreading across the water. The indigo color sparkles in the expanding daylight. The breeze rustles the palm leaves giving a gentle call to the start of the day. At breakfast, you find an array of fresh fruits. Green coconut decorates the table adding the sensual aroma to the dining room. You can hear the sea softly splashing against the sand. You bite into a juicy pineapple and find the taste sweeter than you remember, filling your mouth with an intoxicating candy-like flavor. The day is yours to indulge in the beauty of the resort and the wonders of Viti Levu at your leisure, taking in the wonders of Fiji with your partner at your whim and pleasure. North of the town are the unique Sigatoka Sand Dunes, a national park encompassing 1,606 acres of land. Greenery borders the dunes. The sand undulates across the horizon upwards of 192 feet spanning millennia. You can stroll on the sand hand and hand listening to the waves on the opposite side of the dunes. The landscape around Viti Levu is always inspiring, showing you the natural majesty of the paradise.

dayInfo.title: Viti Levu – Rejuvenating Waters
dayInfo.description: Wake up to another day enjoying the perfect view of the beach from your room. You can lay in bed for awhile with your partner, indulging in the seclusion of the resort and the sensational landscape, flush with trees and the ocean sweeping to the horizon. At breakfast, you can savor the flavors of the island once again by opening a pomelo, a tasty citrus fruit that looks like an orange and grapefruit hybrid. The day is once again yours to delight in all Viti Levu has to offer. Spend time relaxing by the pool with cocktails decorated with sweet fruit and umbrellas, or explore the island to experience some of the inviting culture and exceptional history of the people. Your guide meets you after breakfast and leads you to the jetty along the riverbanks. You board the riverboat and begin your journey upstream. The current is gentle as it rushes out to the ocean, leading down from Mount Victoria and traveling over 74 miles. Along the plains and mountains of the island interior, the river remains an important mode of transportation. The plains of the Sigatoka Valley soon ascend into rugged tree-clad hills and lush mountains. When the river calms, you can see the reflection of the immaculate shores staring back at you on the water’s surface. The gentle pace of the boat brings romance to the journey with the brilliance of the island all around you.

dayInfo.title: Viti Levu – Romantic Island Seclusion
dayInfo.description: At breakfast, you can look at the view provided by the frame of the sloping thatched roof and horizon. The pleasurable aroma of coconut once again accompanies your meal and blends with the decadent taste of freshly brewed coffee. After your meal, your private transfer escorts you to Port Denarau. Board your private boat and get ready to be whisked deeper into the lavish possibilities of the islands. The ocean breeze blows through your hair bringing the renewed scent of the sea from the ocean spray. You travel across the glowing indigo water until reaching Tokoriki Island. White sand beaches encircle the island exterior. Lush jungle hills rise from the heart of the island. Coral reefs extend beneath the water creating a vivacious underwater wonderland. A representative of the resort meets you at the jetty escorting you to your beachfront bure , a traditional Fijian style accommodation filled with modern amenities and an unparalleled beachside view. Your private pool overlooks the water. In the evening the entire island blossoms with the scent of hibiscus flowers. The sun sets over the horizon and layers the sky with golden orange and supple purples. You laze on your veranda taking pleasure in the company, the fabulous view, and the private haven the embracing tropical gardens create.

dayInfo.title: Viti Levu – Discovering the Endless Splendor
dayInfo.description: In the morning, you find the light reflecting off of the water. A sailboat catches the breeze and passes you. You can see an outcropping of islands speckling the horizon in every direction with lush foliage. After breakfast, you can spend the day however you choose. You may consider hiking through the stunning, dense canopy or digging your toes into the comforts of the hot, powdery white sand. For a colorful look at life beyond the island, you and your partner can grab some snorkel gear and step out into the refreshing water. The current gently moves your body back and forth. The water is clear and all encompassing. There are over 1,200 types of coral in Fiji alone. The soft coral waves in the water like a tree in the wind. The hard coral sprouts out of limestone deposits and resembles lively rocks. The world subaquatic colors are entirely different, more vibrant, highlighted by the slight blue coloration of the ocean. Sea sponges ripple when touched. You may see a Bird Wrasse; they can grow up to 12 inches in length and are known for their long, thin nose. They can glow bright yellow or iridescent dark blue with green side scales running along their sides. When you spot one, their lustrous pigment stands out against even the brightest coral.

dayInfo.title: Viti Levu – Romance of Your Surroundings
dayInfo.description: In the morning, outside of your resort, local women set out blankets on the soft sand and display handcrafted jewelry carved out of the island’s elements. The polished pearls, wood, and charms catch the morning light and glint against the white shores. At breakfast, the scent of luscious bananas accompanies your view out to the water. For a unique and romantic experience, you can take part in an island picnic. Your guide meets you at the jetty and whisks you away to a secluded island where you and your partner can spend time basking on the immaculate shore, just the two you. For lunch, the resort packs you something elegant in a charming basket. Once on the sand, you can dip your toes into the water feeling the warmth of the beach and the coolness of the ocean at the same time. You sip champagne underneath the shade of a small thatched hut. You are the only two allowed on the island, offering you the majestic space of a private landscape. Soak in the sunlight, bask in the company, and indulge in the enchanting flavors of Fiji.

dayInfo.title: Viti Levu – Complete Island Relaxation
dayInfo.description: Each day you wake up in paradise makes you more tranquil. The sounds of the water, trees, and soothing music echoes across the walkways and constantly reminds you of the exotic splendor surrounding you. Today you pamper yourself with a couple’s spa treatment for a relaxing experience. Upon entering the bure , you hear the trickle of water falling over a freestanding rock fall, compiled of smooth, dark volcanic stones. The refreshing water runs over your shoulders, caressing your skin and soothing your muscles. Emerald leaves shelter the spa from the island sun. The calming aroma of hibiscus blends with the succulent scent of coconut. Soak with your partner in a therapeutic bath. The hot water feels inviting. Flower petals float on the bath’s surface emanating a bright perfume. The pleasures of relaxation continue when the staff pours two glasses of sparkling wine for you to enjoy. After your day of being wonderfully spoiled, you can spend the night underneath the stars lounging at a private table near the water, and dining on seafood caught fresh that morning. The candlelight flickers in imitation of the night sky. It is you, your partner, and the beach on your final night in Fiji.

dayInfo.title: Viti Levu – Always a Honeymoon
dayInfo.description: The sky is an unfetter blue in the morning, imitating the vast indigo of the ocean. The palm trees are calm without an island breeze. You linger in the room before breakfast absorbing the comforts of your room once more, from the soft sheets to the exceptional panorama out to the water. Tropical fish swim around the coral reefs with continuous vigor. Excited birds call out into the jungle canopy. The island connects the lush canopy to the extraordinary bleached sand. After breakfast, you will return to the main shores of Viti Levu where your private transfer will take you to the airport for your flight home. But, for now, you remember the wonderful spa day of the previous day and relax; the honeymoon hasn’t ended. Please visit the honeymoon vacations section on Zicasso for additional itinerary options.

tourName: Romantic Getaway Vacation to Fiji & Australia
placesVisited: Viti Levu, Davui Island, Mamanuca Islands, Sydney, Nadi
generalInfo: When you think of sailing you can’t help but think of a puff of wind captured by the sails as a boat glides along the horizon in open water with islands that speckle the horizon. Your hand-tailored romantic getaway vacation to Fiji and Australia will bring to life islands and sails, beginning with the emerald green trees across Fiji that will lead you to the famous rippling sails of the Sydney Opera House. Indulge in the romance of a starlit dinner on the shore and explore the lavish neighborhoods of a cosmopolitan city. On this 12-day tour, you will revel in the tropical luxury of Fiji and the modern comfort of Sydney with the one you love.

dayInfo.title: Davui Island - Lavish Tropical Romance
dayInfo.description: Fiji conjures images of exotic trees, crystal clear waters, friendly people, and soft sandy beaches. Upon your arrival at Nadi International Airport, you will quickly realize there is so much more to the island country. Your private transfer will be waiting at the airport to take you to the port for your ferry ride to Davui Island. Viti Levu, the largest of the archipelagic islands, has a sweet aroma of hibiscus that emanates from the tall grass. You will soon board a private shuttle boat that whisks you across the indigo water. The cool morning air becomes misted with the slightly salty aroma of the South Pacific. Davui Island will come into view where your secluded resort awaits with what is known as barefoot luxury. You step onto the island to find luxuriant accommodation as your room opens up to a view of the water and the nearby rolling hills covered in lush foliage. The water laps quietly at the shore as the marble floors provide an extra gloss to the already gleaming resort as people pass you with bright, wide smiles, each person quick to say, “Bula!”

dayInfo.title: Davui Island - Exotic Romance
dayInfo.description: In the morning, you will wake up to a beautiful view of the open water. You can step off your balcony and dip your toes into the cool morning sand. The white, powdery layer rushes into the ocean. At breakfast, the colors of the islands continue to shine brightly, filled with local flavors found around the archipelago - from great coconut to lively pineapple, even succulent pomelo, a fruit similar in looks to a grapefruit but with a more citrusy orange flavor. The day will yours to indulge in the island as you wish, allowing you to absorb the “barefoot luxury” connotation. You can sit in the shade of your balcony listening to the breeze ruffling the palm leaves or lay out on the hot sand of midmorning, dipping your toes into the water now and again to feel the cool ocean refresh your skin. Take out a sea kayak and venture out into the water. The paddles drip onto your seat when you lift them, splashing against the kayak. The current is gentle allowing you to paddle at your own pace. When you look back towards the island you find a panorama of white sand, emerald trees, and indigo ocean settled around your partner for the best view you have ever seen.

dayInfo.title: Davui Island - Enchanting Lagoon
dayInfo.description: At breakfast, you will enjoy both the scenery and the company as you bite into a succulent rambutan underneath the banyan tree canopy. The aroma of sweet fruit blends into the soft sea breeze and the view only gets better each day you are on the private island. After breakfast, you will meet your guide for a daylong excursion to Beqa Lagoon nearly eight miles off the coast of Viti Levu. You will pull on your wetsuit and let the tight fit layer your body like a second skin. Then, you put on the tanks, splash into the water, and follow your guide down below. The sunlight can shine to a depth of 120 feet below the water’s surface, spotlighting florescent fish and equally stunning coral. Coral reefs protect the lagoon from inclement weather, flaking the outer reaches of the bay with up to 18 miles of firm calcite. You will reach a site called Sea Fan Alley, where two rocks form a dramatic corridor opening to a view of gigantic sea fans. The soft coral shimmers with purple, red, and yellow, with over 500 species found around the world that wave up and down in the current.

dayInfo.title: Davui Island - Wild Day Trip
dayInfo.description: The next day, you will spend the morning lounging on your seaside balcony with a private breakfast for you and your partner to share. Listen to waves gently break against the sand with no unnecessary distractions from the beauty in front of you. Following your meal, you will have a private transfer back to Viti Levu for a daytrip along the Navua River. The Rive begins at Mount Gordon and flows around 40 miles through the dense jungle before reaching the ocean. The Upper Navua River meanders around the rainforest highlands, carving the hills into gorges. You and your partner will step onto an inflatable raft and begin to paddle. The water is cool and fresh, unlike the temperate saltwater on the beach. The current will carry you along the river, beside lush hills that turn into limestone walls. Waterfalls brush down the earthen walls and splash into the river creating ripples in the sounds of aquatic thunder. The water turns shades of turquoise against the dense overhanging emerald foliage. Even when paddling through the rush of small rapids you can look around the riverbanks with your partner and notice unparalleled island luxury.

dayInfo.title: Davui Island - Couple’s Day Out
dayInfo.description: You wake up to breakfast and decide to picnic on the beach, where you can pull fresh grapes off of a vine with one hand and dig your other hand into the warming indulgent sand. The seaside paradise heightens the already romantic ambiance between you and your partner. You will spend today pampering each other, truly relaxing with a couple’s spa treatment that combines modern methods with ancient care for a refreshing day. The scent of fresh coconut milk mixes with the sea breeze. The small breaking waves will become the soundtrack to your massage. You will embrace the sweet, captivating coconut aroma, as you settle into the soothing touch of your masseuse. At night, you and your partner can sit under the stars at a private table near the water and enjoy a specially prepared menu.

dayInfo.title: Davui Island - Sensuality of Cuisine
dayInfo.description: Over the past few days, you will have discovered the sensual nature of food, enjoying the flavors of the local traditional fruits and cuisine of the island, and taking pleasure in your partner’s company at each meal. After breakfast, you will spend time with a cooking demonstration where you will learn how to prepare one, or a number of Fiji’s succulent dishes. The fresh seafood caught around the islands can’t be beat. Your chef will show you how to create a decadent lolo , coconut cream, to help steep prawns caught earlier that morning. You add onions and tomatoes and let the ingredients slowly simmer until the decadent dish is complete and ready to taste. The sweet and savory flavors marry perfectly in every bite, making the dish rich but not heavy. The demonstration will bring you and your partner closer together as you agree that you should make the dish at home at the first opportunity.

dayInfo.title: Davui Island - Magnificence Daze
dayInfo.description: Each morning you will wake up to the swaying palm trees and sweeping white sand of the island and have to remind yourself that this tropical paradise is real, and the person you are sharing the luxuries of the island lifestyle with is just as real. Your last full day in Fiji will be at your whim and pleasure, allowing you to bask by the pool or sip an ice cold drink while you are knee deep in the ocean. For an adventurous day, you can venture back to the rainforest of Viti Levu where you will meet your guide at the port and head up into the rainforest canopy. The dense emerald leaves are brighter the higher up in the trees you climb. You step out onto a platform with your partner, dressed in a helmet and industrial harness. Your guide will clip you to the line and count down from three before you suddenly soar through treetops. The wind will blow against your cheeks and you will feel the rush as you speed through the air. The leaves will turn a blurry green and you will hear the river rushing below you as it winds along the rocky banks. You will arrive at the platform across the canopy, with 16 total lines to glide down. Then watch as your partner cries out with excitement as they fly across the rainforest.

dayInfo.title: Sydney - Best of Harbor Life
dayInfo.description: When you wake up in the morning, you opt for one more private balcony breakfast overlooking the pristine beach. The music of the breeze and breaking waves creates the charming atmosphere you have celebrated since your arrival in Fiji. After your meal, the resort boat will take you back to the marina on Viti Levu where a private transfer escorts you to the airport for your flight to Sydney, Australia. The city maintains a relaxed beachside energy with a lush edge, where people enjoy the surf and sand along with elegant outfits and opulent dining. Your private transfer will meet you at the airport and escorts you to a luxurious hotel with a view overlooking Darling Harbour, home to the charming rooftop sails of the Sydney Opera House.

dayInfo.title: Sydney - Coupling Exploration
dayInfo.description: On your first morning in Sydney, the sunrise hovers over the horizon and casts layers of orange and purple along the white ceramic tiles of the opera house. The light glints off of the pristine arching design to mirror the morning hues. At breakfast, you will enjoy the refreshing coastal breeze with a romantic view of the boats that venture away from the harbor. After your meal, ride a bicycle to explore the cityscape away from the main streets, where you can enjoy a different view of the city. You and your partner will ride side by side through the Royal Botanic Gardens, where the aroma of blossoming lilies and roses has braced the lush greenery since the early 19th century. The skyline begins to shape, overlooking the gardens. You ride over to the Manly Beach’s Scenic Walkway, a 7-mile stretch of that connects Manly to Spit Bridge. The views that overlook the harbor are immaculate as they open up the surrounding sub-tropical rainforest, which is juxtaposed by shimmering coastal waters and the modern, luxurious suburbs situated near the harbor. Birds twitter in the trees, the fertile landscape emanates a piney aroma, and you will watch as sailboats glide underneath the bridge.

dayInfo.title: Sydney - Bright Beaches
dayInfo.description: Bondi Beach is known for its spectacular surf, joyfully relaxed atmosphere, and the combination of boardwalk fish and chips with elegant modern dining establishments that overlook the water. After breakfast, you will make the quick journey to the far reaches of the beach along the inviting golden sands. Waves break near the edges of the bay but the current pushes the water into the sides of the Olympic sized swimming pool underneath the Bondi Icebergs swimming club. The club was established in 1929 and remains a place for people to practice swimming in the winter. The beach has been featured in American and Australian pop culture including the hit reality series, Bondi Rescue. The sand soaks up the heat from the sun and the water is refreshingly cold, as it will cool down your skin after the sun washes over it. The sea mist splashes through the air and blends in with the enticing aroma of fresh fish and chips situated on the esplanade. For classic fare overlooking the water, you can enjoy a meal in the Icebergs Swimming Club dining room.

dayInfo.title: Sydney - Romancing the City
dayInfo.description: You wake up to the bustling energy along the harbor, where ferries cross to the suburb-lined shores opposite the city center. After breakfast, you and your partner will enjoy Sydney and its surroundings at your leisure. Venture outside of the city to witness the natural majesty of the Blue Mountains National Park or stroll the neighborhood of Gleve, filled with young professionals, local cafes, and a charming park. Near your hotel you will find the Rocks, situated at the protruding tongue of the natural harbor. The area is the first home of the Gadigal aboriginal tribe and it became the first European settlement on the continent. Over 100 heritage sites commemorate the city and Australia’s history, including the oldest surviving house in the city, Cadman’s Cottage, which was constructed in 1816. Restaurants and cafes line the narrow cobbled streets and market stalls situate themselves inside historic facades while aboriginal art galleries display traditional styles of cultural art. The aroma of freshly baked pretzels mixes with the sweet cream of a local ice cream shop, making it the perfect place to stroll hand in hand with your partner and meld into the city like a local.

dayInfo.title: Sydney - Crossing the Ocean
dayInfo.description: The Queen Victoria Building was erected in the late 1890s and it stands 620 feet long as it fills an entire city block. The QVB continues to decorate downtown Sydney and displays the original clocks of its coronation inside. The city overflows with charm, from the street side cafes to the elegant art scene hidden behind a casual, relaxed ambiance. After breakfast, a private transfer escorts you to Sydney airport for your flight home. You will have strolled along treasured Fijian beaches and witness the sensational Sydney skyline. You could always extend your stay in Australia by visiting Australia tours for additional travel itineraries, or you can venture north to take in the Great Barrier Reef, bookending your romantic vacation with one more bright ecosystem to explore.

tourName: Scuba, Snorkel & Adventure Vacation in Fiji
placesVisited: Savusavu, Nadi, Rabi Island, Qamea Island, Taveuni Island, Cobia
generalInfo: Step aboard a luxurious yacht and hear a sincere Fijian greeting, Bula! The welcome takes you beyond a normal hello, inviting you into the indulgent comforts of the ship, readying you for the ethereal natural beauty of the islands, and reminding you to take pleasure in every second of the journey. Your excursion is hand tailored to take you around the delicate glow of celebrated coral reefs and the often-overlooked islands along the northern edge of the archipelago. The islands will immediately enchant you, and you will soon discover the blissful possibilities of Fiji.

dayInfo.title: Fijian Cruise – Aboard the Welcome Boat
dayInfo.description: Fiji is known for its paradisiacal landscape, brimming with tropical forests that spread across 322 islands, reaching pristine beaches filled with powdery white sand. The water shimmers azure, ranging from crystal clear to dark blue at its deepest depths. You arrive in Nadi early in the morning and continue to the city of Savusavu located on the island of Vanua Levu. The tropical paradise no longer fills your imagination but comes to life before your very eyes. Lush mountains slope downwards edging the azure bay. The scent of hibiscus flowers blends into the sea breeze. Locals have bright, wide smiles and greet you with “ Bula!” meaning more than just hello, but a friendly greeting that encompasses the welcoming spirit of the Fijian islands. Your private transfer, arranged by one of Zicasso's travel agents for Fiji , meets you at the airport and takes you to the harbor where your cruise ship awaits. The boat is 140 feet long with beams towering like the palm trees up to 33 feet tall. The staff offers a warm and endearing greeting, filled with excitement and a complimentary glass of champagne. Soft cushions line the upper deck and provide a fanciful panorama of the bay. In the afternoon, the boat weighs anchor. The ocean breeze turns into a moving wind that brushes your cheeks. The beauty of the islands is matched only by the luxury of your cruise.

dayInfo.title: Fijian Cruise – Room with a View
